comments.text:
The App component has the App Container group that gives the gray background. The Header component shows what step the user is on and then the Page Router handles the navigation between the Pages that has the questions.

From the Page Router we get the Current Page Title and give it to the Header component that displays it.
A component that controls which buttons are shown at the bottom of each page.

The Header component displays the Current Page title and also has a progress bar showing how far the user has come in the flow. If you add more pages you will want to update the States node and add more Step states.

The States node uses the current page input to decide what state it is in. It is important that the State names and the page titles are exactly the same so that the States node updates to the correct state.

The States node decides what title we show and how much progress the progress bar shows.
This simple Progress Bar is built using Group nodes. One is the white background with rounded corners and the Progressbar Inner Group is the blue bar that fills up.
This is a Radio Button that has been customized to have a nice white background when it's selected.

parameters.text: How often do you listen to music? ♫

parameters.Label: A couple of times a week

comments.text: This is the Page for the first question or the first step in the Survey App. It contains Custom Radio Button components and you have to make a selection to enable the next button.
Here we save the answer in an Object so that we can display all the answers on the Summary page. Once the answer has been saved we navigate to the next page
Here we use a Strings Length property to decide if the Next button should be enabled or not. If the length is 0 it will be disabled, if it is any number higher than 0 it will be enabled.

As soon as a Custom Checkbox is mounted it will create a new object and save the label input it gets in the object. That object will then be added or removed to the q2 answers array based on the state of the Checkbox

This Custom Checkbox is made to look like a circle, and the built in label has been disabled and instead we have a Text node that we use as the label. This is done so that the Text can be in the center of the Checkbox, that has been made into a circle.
This States node controls the color of the label of the Custom Checkbox

parameters.text: What is your favorite genre of music?

comments.text: This is the Page for step 2 in the Survey. Here the user has to make a selection from some Custom Checkbox components. The selection is saved into an array, and that array is then saved to the answers Object so that it can be displayed on the Summary page.

Arrays are global, meaning an array with the same id is the same no matter what component it is in. Here we have and array with the id q2 answers, and that same array is being used inside the Custom Checkbox component to add or remove objects. 

When we first navigate to this Page and it is mounted we make sure that we clear this array so that it is empty. 

When the user has made their choices, the array is saved to the answers object so that we can display it in the Summary Page

This is the Custom Slider. It's built up of the slider item components. It is also worth pointing out that the Custom Slider Group in the node tree below has been rotated -90 degrees so that we get a vertical slider instead of a horizontal slider.

The current slider value is saved in a variable and is then used on the slider item components. Variables are global. The Slider is set up to have the exact same number of intervals as we have slider items.

This is important so that the expression in the slider item components work correctly.

Each slider item will have a child index that is based on it's position as a child to the Group node that it is in. This index is compared to the current slider value to decide if this item should be colorized or not.
These nodes control which color this particular item will have. The Color Blend outputs the exact color and sets it as the color property for the active state in the States node
The slider items get a nice color depending on if they are active or not. They are active if their Child Index is below the current slider value.

parameters.text: How loud do you listen to music?

comments.text: This is the Page for step 3 in the Survey. Here the user makes a selection using a Custom Slider and the number of the slider is then saved in the answers Object to be displayed on the Summary Page.

parameters.Question title: How often do you listen to music?
What is your favorite genre of music?

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

parameters.Question title: How loud do you listen to music?

comments.text:
This is the Summary Page that displays the users final choices.

All the answers from the previous Pages have been recorded in the answers Object and are displayed here.

Note that the q2 answers are in an array and so a Repeater node is used to generate a Summary Checkbox component for each object in the array.
This component is used to show the answers from Step 2 in the Survey
This is a component that is being used in the Summary Page. It creates a nice layout for each question and the answers that the the user supplied.
